name: bilocation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the ability to be in two places at the same time: He joked that he did not have the gift of bilocation and was therefore not able to take part in two live interviews simultaneously. The novel is set in a world where bilocation is possible.
More examplesFewer examplesMany cases of bilocation were attributed to the famous monk, who never left his monastery and yet appeared to the faithful in far-off lands. The saint was renowned from a young age for her spiritual raptures, visions, and gifts of prophecy and bilocation.
